CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 20, 1944, pg. 13 reads: "Cute, Coy, Clever--All three of the above adjectives fir petite Rosita Lockhart whose famous "Chicken Dance" is one of the most unique and original in show business. The surprise ending is really something to see. She recently completed a smash engagement at the Celebrity club in Pittsburgh. After a short tour of the Midwest, she will go east. In addition to her "Chicken Dance," Rosita does a large number of interpretive dances. Most critics say the young lady is going places and doing big things in show business.-- Harris Photo." Cutline for related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, April 3, 1948, pg. 17, reads: "Novel Dance - Rosita Lockhart, diminutive dancer with a new look in acts, the 'Chicken Dance,' is scoring on her Southern tour. Rosita portrays hte [the] hatching of a live chicken, and the method continues to be a source of wonder to her audiences."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of woman, Rosita  Lockhart wearing spangled two piece costume, long dark fingerless gloves, and flowers in hair, posed holding baby chick, seated on wooden bench, in front of dark curtain, in Harris Studio
